name: PCI DSS
fullName: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
description: PCI DSS provides a rigorous technical and operational baseline for protecting Cardholder Data (CHD) and Sensitive Authentication Data (SAD). Version 4.0.1 emphasizes continuous security, risk-based customization via the Customized Approach, and robust authentication. It applies to any entity that stores, processes, or transmits payment card information.

certificationDetails.assessor: Qualified Security Assessor (QSA) or Internal Security Assessor (ISA)

lifecycle.name: Scope & Assess
lifecycle.description: Identify all locations of cardholder data. Map data flows. Define the Cardholder Data Environment (CDE) boundaries.
keyActivities: Determine SAQ type or ROC requirement

lifecycle.name: Remediate & Repair
lifecycle.description: Fix identified gaps. Securely dispose of unnecessary data. Implement required security controls.

lifecycle.name: Report & Validate
lifecycle.description: Complete ROC or SAQ. Submit compliance documentation. Validate with assessor.

lifecycle.name: Continuous Compliance
lifecycle.description: Maintain compliance through continuous monitoring, quarterly scans, and annual reassessment.

domains.name: Build and Maintain a Secure Network and Systems
domains.description: Establish and maintain secure network architecture and system configurations.

controls.name: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls
controls.description: Install and maintain network security controls to restrict traffic to and from the Cardholder Data Environment (CDE).
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy firewalls between CDE and untrusted networks. Implement network segmentation. Restrict inbound/outbound traffic to business-necessary flows. Review firewall rules semi-annually.

controls.name: Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components
controls.description: Eliminate vendor-supplied defaults and apply secure baseline configurations to all system components.
controls.implementationGuidance: Change all vendor defaults. Apply CIS benchmarks. Document secure configurations. Harden all systems before deployment.

domains.name: Protect Account Data
domains.description: Protect stored cardholder data and encrypt transmissions over public networks.

controls.name: Protect Stored Account Data
controls.description: Protect stored account data using strong cryptography. PAN must be rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored.
controls.implementationGuidance: Encrypt PAN using AES-256. Implement tokenization where possible. Never store SAD after authorization. Implement key management procedures.

controls.name: Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission
controls.description: Protect cardholder data with strong cryptography when transmitted over open, public networks.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce TLS 1.2+ (prefer TLS 1.3). Disable deprecated protocols. Never send PAN via unencrypted email. Validate certificates.

domains.name: Maintain a Vulnerability Management Program
domains.description: Protect systems against malware and develop secure systems and applications.

controls.name: Protect All Systems and Networks from Malicious Software
controls.description: Deploy, maintain, and regularly update anti-malware software across all systems commonly affected.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy antimalware on all systems. Enable automatic updates. Perform periodic scans. Alert on detections.

controls.name: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems and Software
controls.description: Develop secure software by integrating security into the SDLC. Apply critical patches promptly.
controls.implementationGuidance: Follow secure coding standards (OWASP). Conduct code reviews. Integrate SAST/DAST. Patch critical vulnerabilities within 30 days. Train developers.

domains.name: Implement Strong Access Control Measures
domains.description: Restrict access to cardholder data and system components.

controls.name: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know
controls.description: Restrict access strictly by business need-to-know principles.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement RBAC with least privilege. Define access based on job function. Review access quarterly. Remove access upon role change.

controls.name: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
controls.description: Assign unique user IDs. Implement MFA for all access to the CDE.
controls.implementationGuidance: Assign unique IDs to all users. Enforce MFA for CDE access. Implement strong password policies (12+ characters). Lock accounts after failed attempts.

controls.name: Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data
controls.description: Restrict, log, and monitor physical access to facilities containing cardholder data environments.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement badge access for sensitive areas. Maintain visitor logs. Deploy surveillance cameras. Restrict media access.

domains.name: Regularly Monitor and Test Networks
domains.description: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data. Test security systems regularly.

controls.name: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data
controls.description: Implement extensive logging mechanisms to track and monitor all access.
controls.implementationGuidance: Log all access to CHD. Include timestamps, user IDs, event types. Centralize logs in SIEM. Review daily. Retain for 12 months (3 months immediately available).

controls.name: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly
controls.description: Test security through quarterly vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and wireless access point monitoring.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct quarterly ASV scans (external). Perform internal scans after significant changes. Annual penetration test. Wireless scanning quarterly.

domains.name: Maintain an Information Security Policy
domains.description: Create, maintain, and disseminate a comprehensive information security policy.

controls.name: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
controls.description: Create, maintain, and disseminate a comprehensive organizational information security policy reviewed annually.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop comprehensive infosec policy. Review annually. Include incident response plan. Define acceptable use. Train all personnel.

breachNotification.timeframe: Per card brand requirements and applicable law
breachNotification.notifyAuthority: Card brands (Visa, MC, Amex, Discover, JCB) and acquiring bank
breachNotification.threshold: Any suspected or confirmed breach of cardholder data
